SEARCH
Package cz.cvut.fel.omo.semestral.entity.devices.appliances

Class Appliance

java.lang.Object
cz.cvut.fel.omo.semestral.entity.devices.appliances.Appliance
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDevice, IDeviceCommand, Tickable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Alarm, Fridge, Gate, HVAC, Light, TV
public abstract class Appliance extends Object implements IDevice, IDeviceCommand, Tickable
Abstract base class for appliances in the smart home system. This class serves as a foundation for various types of home appliances, providing common attributes such as serial number, state, wear, and power consumption. Each specific appliance type extends this class and implements its own behavior through the executeCommand method, allowing for dynamic control of appliance actions such as turning on or off and adjusting settings.

  • Constructor Details

    • Appliance

      public Appliance(UUID serialNumber, int wearCapacity)
      Constructs a new Appliance with the specified serial number and wear capacity. The appliance is initialized with a default state of OFF, total wear of 0, and total power consumption of 0.
      Parameters:
      serialNumber - The unique identifier for this appliance.
      wearCapacity - The maximum wear capacity of this appliance.

    • Appliance

      public Appliance(UUID serialNumber, DeviceState state, int totalWear, double totalPowerConsumption, int wearCapacity)
      Constructs a new Appliance with the specified serial number, state, total wear, total power consumption, and wear capacity.
      Parameters:
      serialNumber - The unique identifier for this appliance.
      state - The current state of this appliance.
      totalWear - The total wear of this appliance.
      totalPowerConsumption - The total power consumption of this appliance.
      wearCapacity - The maximum wear capacity of this appliance.

  • Method Details

    • executeCommand

      public abstract void executeCommand(DeviceCommand command)
      Executes the specified command on this appliance. This method should be implemented by subclasses to define specific behaviors.
      Specified by:
      executeCommand in interface IDeviceCommand
      Parameters:
      command - The command to be executed.

    • setState

      public void setState(DeviceState state)
      Sets the state of the appliance to the specified state. If the new state is different from the current state, the appliance state is updated and the appliance is notified of the change.
      Specified by:
      setState in interface IDevice
      Parameters:
      state - The new state of the appliance.

      public void updatePowerConsumption(double powerConsumption)

      Specified by:
      updatePowerConsumption in interface IDevice
      Parameters:
      powerConsumption - the amount of power to add to the total consumption.

    • updateWear

      public void updateWear(int wear)
      Updates the wear of the device. This method increments the total wear of the device by the specified amount.
      Specified by:
      updateWear in interface IDevice
      Parameters:
      wear - the amount of wear to add to the total wear.

    • addMalfunctionObserver

      public void addMalfunctionObserver(DeviceMalfunctionObserver observer)
      Adds a malfunction observer to this device. The observer will be notified when the device malfunctions.
      Specified by:
      addMalfunctionObserver in interface IDevice
      Parameters:
      observer - the observer to be added.

    • notifyMalfunctionObservers

      public void notifyMalfunctionObservers()
      Notifies all registered malfunction observers about a malfunction. This method is called when the device state changes to MALFUNCTION.
      Specified by:
      notifyMalfunctionObservers in interface IDevice

    • checkIfBroken

      public void checkIfBroken()
      Checks if the device is broken based on its wear. If the total wear exceeds the wear capacity, the device state is set to MALFUNCTION.
      Specified by:
      checkIfBroken in interface IDevice

    • onTick

      public abstract void onTick()
      Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to define actions on each tick.
      Specified by:
      onTick in interface Tickable

    • addtoActionPlan

      public void addtoActionPlan(DeviceCommand command)
      Adds a device command to the action plan queue. The command will be executed when performAllActions() is called.
      Parameters:
      command - the device command to be added to the action plan.

    • performAllActions

      public void performAllActions()
      Executes all actions in the action plan. This method processes and executes each command in the action plan queue.

    • getSerialNumber

      public UUID getSerialNumber()
      Returns the serial number of the device.
      Specified by:
      getSerialNumber in interface IDevice
      Returns:
      the UUID representing the serial number of the device.

    • repair

      public void repair(Manual manual)
      Repairs the device using a manual. This method resets the wear of the device and sets its state to ON.
      Specified by:
      repair in interface IDevice
      Parameters:
      manual - the manual used for repairing the device.

    • repair

      public void repair()
      Repairs the device without a manual. This method partially resets the wear of the device and sets its state to ON.
      Specified by:
      repair in interface IDevice
